name: Ladyfingers
author: Roxanne Shepphird
summary: To make Chocolate Lady Fingers, substitute 3/4 cup all-purpose flour plus 2 tablespoons cocoa powder for the all-purpose flour.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C)
Line two  17 x 12 inch baking sheets with baking parchment
Fit large pastry bag with a plain 1/2 inch round tube
Place egg whites in bowl and beat on high until soft peaks start to form
Slowly add 2 tablespoons of the sugar and continue beating until stiff and glossy
In another bowl beat egg yolks  and remaining sugar
Whip until thick and very pale in color
Sift flour and baking powder together on a sheet of wax paper
Fold half the egg whites into the egg yolk mixture
Fold in flour, and then add the remaining egg whites
Transfer mixture to pastry bag and pipe out onto prepared baking sheet
